body.text: I agree with Mr. Ford. Lilley you are columnist for the Toronto Sun, you can do your job from the comforts of your home without contact with others, shame on you for professing that others should get out there and hope they will not be infected with COVID-19. As for trusting the WHO, I kindly suggest that you read more and write less.... End of Rant -30-
I need my children and grandchildren alive to pay for a quality Canadian future. Please listen to the experts.

The time for real concern was over a month ago... we have learned that the virus isn't nearly as bad as predicted or as dangerous to the average person. I agree that Ford should begin opening things up much quicker at this point, the economic and societal health of the province is at stake.

I have had a problem with this situation from the beginning. It's not just Ford, its Trudeau and all of the world leaders. "We will only go forward with the approval of our "Experts". The last time I checked, world leaders were "Elected" by their populace. Experts were not. If Ford, I will use him as an example, keeps telling us that he will not proceed without the approval of his experts, why do we vote? A leader is supposed to sit down with the experts, listen to what they say, discuss things with the "other" experts, like economic advisors, psychology advisors, cancer treatment advisors, cardiac advisors, etc. and come to a conclusion, and ultimately, an informed personal decision. Otherwise, you are NOT the leader. If you want us to shut down as we did, fine, but OWN it. Say it is your decision. Churchill walked through Coventry after it was bombed to crap.  He waved at the people trying to boost their spirits, all the time knowing he could have warned them and saved some lives.  However, if he had warned them, he would have tipped off the Germans to the fact that we had decoded the enigma machine, and perhaps extended the war causing even greater casualties. He made the decision as a leader. I myself would have not been able to sleep after such a decision, and have no idea what I would have done in his situation, but that is what "Leaders" do. My other problem with this whole "Expert" thing, is the fact that the last time I checked there is no one alive in this “Expert” world who has EVER dealt with a global pandemic like we are experiencing. So how exactly are they experts? Yes, they've gone to universities (I'm a graduate by the way so do not dare say I'm uneducated and don't understand science) but what they’ve done is studied things like the Spanish Flu, come up with models and theories that seem to be correct based on peer review, but are they accurate? Scientists are just like you and me, they try their best, they have good intentions, but they are just as capable as the rest of us to screw up. They fly by the seat of their pants, and most importantly, they make mistakes.
Obviously Lilly only cares about himself.
HEY FOLKS ! You can go out , stay in , . Your decision to make . Me ? I’m going to continue on doing what I’m doing , shopping ,gardening ,  the usual , maybe some fishing this weekend 🎣
Ford is right in opening slowly is for our own good.
So, time to move to Edmonton? See ya.
Oh no poor Lilley can't get a haircut or go to a restaurant.......no problems with the thousands dead though.
It's always easy to armchair quarterback with people's lives, when you know you'll never be accountable for those that are snuffed out.

Halton Region has 600 cases out of a population of 600,000 which is about .1 per cent...The numbers have been wrong from the first day now is the time to correct those bad decisions and fully open areas which have low cases. LIBERATE ONTARIO!

The normal flu kills more people every year than Covid 19 has. We never lockdown for the flu. This seems like a test to see how the sheeple will tolerate totalitarianism. So far it has worked, probing that people do not have the guts to say screw it and keep things open. No guts, no glory, what a sad society I live in.

Has no one read about how many asympotmatic infected carriers they found on the island of Montreal, now that they have seriously ramped up the testing?  Over 20,000 on the island of Montreal alone!!  Not heard that Quebec is backing off opening the schools because of it?  Tens of thousands more than they expected to find.  One guy that went to two bars in Shanghai has infected 58 people in one evening?  You are going to go right back to exponential growth again as soon as you open up too fast.  They opened up in Wisconsin yesterday, and the yahoos went out and filled the bars!  Darwin's theory will be working overtime and the second wave will be a tsunami.  Hold on to your toques, Canada!
the longer he waits the more people will loose their job for good,
When it comes to Ford doing things, I am very much critical. However, on this issue, I am with him. We'd rather err on the safety than risk thousand and more lives - yes, both young and old.
sounds like an American republican

Why are people so paranoid about a virus that targets old people in confined populated spaces. You don't cut
off a finger to cure a hang nail. If you're so worried stay home.
If the hange nail has gangareen you do.

Garfield Smith That is the problem with you people. You turn a hang nail into gangereen without the facts.
The facts are; it's killing a lot of old people. Really bad flu for them. You can't argue with that.
What a horrible thing to say... One day you will be elderly also... Hope there is not another super-bug when you reach your senior years...!
And if another large outbreak occurs they will be saying Ford acted too soon. Better safe than sorry.
especially the 2 idiots earlier saying we waited long enough.
Agree that it is wrong to say it is up to the unelected health officials- you get elected to make decisions.
Good gosh, when there is a pandemic then ALL our leaders rely on them for their professional opinion... are you daft?
Golf is not essential, it’s not even a sport. It’s a game and a boring one at that.
Correct Golf is not essential, but it does offer exercise and people can remain apart on a golf course... You should try it, it's fun.
.....and besides that, who's cutting his hair?  Think they can squeeze me in?  My guy has been out of reach for a couple of months.
Joe exotic...

To use an old Star Trek reference, its like Captain Kirk has ceded command of The Entreprise to Mckoy...."Dammit Jim, we can't re-open yet".  Our response isn't the only response, everyone says they're following the best advice of medical professionals and following the science....but not every one is responding the same.  Sweden opted not to lock down to nearly our degree, and the reason wasn't to build herd immunity, its because that country's top epidemilogist was smart enough to realize this is going to be a marathon, not a sprint....and you can't lock down people for a year or more until a vaccine comes out.....Epidemilogy is one science, but its not the only science, what do epidemologists know about depression that comes from job loss and economic stress, about resulting alcoholism and substance abuse, child and spousal abuse...suicide.
Rob Ollerenshaw If you look at the recent data Sweden is trending DOWN.  The doom and gloom forcasts did not come true.  In fact the FORECASTS are about 1 100th of what they expected.

Or Scotty, "She's gonna blow, Captain!!"  I don't think we can judge Sweden yet, Gordon.  Their deaths per million of population is way higher than a lot of countries.  And infections are climbing once again. Same with Brazil with no lockdown.  No argument about the many other consequences that you mention, though.  And those effects are global, not just here.

i agree .this so called author comes off sounding like a complete idiot .Ford is opening things slowly and safely .Please Brian Lilley please put your head back up your Ahhhh....... back in the sand .

Kim Albertini with the useless Prime Minister taxes are going up anyways it doesn’t matter what you do. But I am just saying better safe than sorry. Are you trying to get out and go to a ball game soon and get sick. Or are you one of the geniuses that gather in the parks in groups?

Chris Rotchill arent many icu units as well as many hospitol beds empty ?   How many people have died  in this province versus the population. how many canadians have died for other sicknesses over the past year ? we have flattened the curve,now its time for herd immunity

Fords plan is to open slowly and then turn the province into a bankrupy venezuela.When huge unemployment,heavy taxes and debt,cuts to health care because they have become unaffordable(no revenue coming in), then we will see another kind of virus---the great depression
Doug Ford is a major disappointment....
lmao. Yeah we did so freaking great under the liberals didn’t we? They pretty much bankrupted the province
Kim Albertini Yes and we’ve done so great with the liberals didn’t we?
i believe he will be a one term prenier,he is a disaster

and as someone neither elected nor educated in epidemiology, or, presumably economics, one would think you'd keep out of the argument - for the public good. But you took muckraking 101 somewhere.... Carlton maybe?
educated ineconomics ?  did upu see the unemployment rate in Ontario ? and it will go up. as far as docs go,misdiagnosis happens all the time

what an ignorant and self-centered author
this is typical of the Toronto mentality and what could incite wave 2 and the crippling of the province
The province is already crippled. What planet have you been living on?
Mark LaRonde Wynne crippled it long before Ford was even elected, what country have you been living in snowflake?
Then stay home

Please, for the sake of Canada, don't ever run for public office. Not that you'd have a chance with your prioritization of money over human lives. Incidentally, the United States of America is probably a better fit for the likes of you, both as a journalist and whatever else you aspire to be.
The first sentence got your point across just fine. But hey, why not add a superfluous second sentence just so you can take a big steaming crap on the USA.

On this you are wrong I would be rather he be on the safe side. So you sit at home nice and safe write your article and don’t worry about catching it. And yes smaller population may make other areas easier to open up

everybody6s on for the safe side till the bills come in,taxes go up due to heavy debt,people go unemployed and health services get cut because the province cant afford it. its called venezuela---welcome to bankruptcy

To all those who slam Brian Lilley, what will you be saying when the real cost of all the shutdown are in? And wait until taxes start going up, way, way up so governments can get back all they spent. I know of public servants who are sitting at home, relaxing and just loving all this. They get to collect a full pay cheque and do nothing.
Just like the song from Dire Straits; "Money for nothing and the Cheques for free"    They must be just printing out money on overtime!   Hard to believe or know how long this could go on
